intro: Cliffortia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy cliffortia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, showy white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific conditions to flourish.
